channel.title: Characters .dat to .txt
channel.description:
So when new players log on, their character files are made into a .dat file and read by .dat, but I've changed it to .txt, so it's easier to open. The whole point of that was to edit my skills for example, but the .txt files for characters are still weird and I can't manage to edit a character when the .txt reads this [code]¬¨√≠ sr PlayerSaveZ@‚Äù¬®_√Ä¬∞6 I playerHeadIconI playerHeightI playerPosXI playerPosYI playerRightsI playerStatus[ bankItemst [I[ bankItemsNq ~ [ playerEquipmentq ~ [ playerEquipmentNq ~ [ playerItemq ~ [ playerItemNq ~ [ playerLevelq ~ L playerNamet Ljava/lang/String;L playerPassq ~ [ playerQuestq ~ [ playerXPq ~ xp * \ ur [IM¬∫`&v√™¬≤¬• xp  uq ~   uq ~   { √Ø ¬Ω  ] ¬± _ # % √∂ ruq ~             ¬æuq ~  uq ~  uq ~                          t prayert fpuq ~   0 √ö [/code]
How can I make the characters .txt look like [code]ACCOUNT] character-username = username character-password = password
[CHARACTER] character-height = 0 character-posx = 3088 character-posy = 3500 character-rights = 0 character-lastconnection = character-special = 100 character-tz = -1 character-starter = 0 character-expLock = false character-pouch1 = 0 character-pouch2 = 0 character-pouch3 = 0 character-pouch4 = 0 character-energy = 100 character-taskID = -1 character-taskAmount = -1 character-jad = 0 character-q1 = 15 character-q2 = 15 character-q3 = 15 character-q4 = 15 character-q5 = 15 character-q6 = 15 character-q7 = 15 character-q8 = 15 character-q9 = 15 character-q10 = 15 character-q11 = 15 character-Ahrim = 0 character-Verac = 0 character-Dharok =0 character-Torag = 0 character-Karils =0 character-Guthan =0 character-Barrows 0 character-brightness = 0 character-fighttype = 1 character-skill = 0 character-chat = 0 character-ancients = 0 character-pin = 0 character-pkPoints = 0 character-saradomin = 0 character-retaliate = 0 character-action = 0 character-pcpoints = 0 character-assault = 0 character-donator = 0 character-bow = 100 character-donorPoints = 0 character-shield = 100 character-rating = 0 character-hween09 = 0
[EQUIPMENT] character-equip = 0 0 0 character-equip = 1 0 0 character-equip = 2 0 0 character-equip = 3 0 0 character-equip = 4 0 0 character-equip = 5 0 0 character-equip = 6 0 0 character-equip = 7 0 0 character-equip = 8 0 0 character-equip = 9 0 0 character-equip = 10 0 0 character-equip = 11 0 0 character-equip = 12 0 0 character-equip = 13 0 0
[LOOK] character-look = 0 0 character-look = 1 1 character-look = 2 16 character-look = 3 20 character-look = 4 31 character-look = 5 33 character-look = 6 39 character-look = 7 42 character-look = 8 3 character-look = 9 1 character-look = 10 2 character-look = 11 3 character-look = 12 0 character-look = 13 2 character-look = 14 6 character-look = 15 7 character-look = 16 10 character-look = 17 5 character-look = 18 0
[SKILLS] character-skill = 0 1 0 character-skill = 1 1 0 character-skill = 2 1 0 character-skill = 3 10 1155 character-skill = 4 1 0 character-skill = 5 1 0 character-skill = 6 1 0 character-skill = 7 1 0 character-skill = 8 1 0 character-skill = 9 1 0 character-skill = 10 1 0 character-skill = 11 1 0 character-skill = 12 1 0 character-skill = 13 1 0 character-skill = 14 1 0 character-skill = 15 1 0 character-skill = 16 1 0 character-skill = 17 1 0 character-skill = 18 1 0 character-skill = 19 1 0 character-skill = 20 1 0 character-skill = 21 1 0 character-skill = 22 1 0 character-skill = 23 1 0 character-skill = 24 1 0

So when new players log on, their character files are made into a .dat file and read by .dat, but I‚Äôve changed it to .txt, so it‚Äôs easier to open. The whole point of that was to edit my skills for example, but the .txt files for characters are still weird and I can‚Äôt manage to edit a character when the .txt reads this
